thread.title: Henrikh Mkhitaryan and Michael Carrick set to miss EFL Cup final after limping out of St Etienne clash
thread.title_full: Henrikh Mkhitaryan and Michael Carrick set to miss EFL Cup final after limping out of St Etienne clash

author: Liam Prenderville
title: Henrikh Mkhitaryan and Michael Carrick set to miss EFL Cup final after limping out of St Etienne clash

organizations.name: manchester united win europa league tie share

text:
Sport Henrikh Mkhitaryan and Michael Carrick set to miss EFL Cup final after limping out of St Etienne clash The Armenian had given United the lead in the Europa League second leg with a clever finish but was replaced by Marcus Rashford Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Mourinho reacts as Manchester United win Europa League tie Share this video Get Manchester United FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Manchester United are set to be without Henrikh Mkhitaryan and Michael Carrick for Sunday's EFL Cup final. 
Mkhitaryan had given United the lead against St Etienne in the Europa League second leg with a near-post finish. 
But he was withdrawn after just 25 minutes and held the back of his right leg as he made his way off. 
Marcus Rashford replaced the midfielder in France and would likely battle with Anthony Martial for a starting spot at Wembley, should Mkhitaryan not make it. 
Carrick was also withdrawn during the second-half with a calf strain and Mourinho admitted both are unlikely to feature against Southampton. Mkhitaryan gives United the lead (Photo: Getty Images) Marcus Rashford replaces Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Photo: REUTERS) 
"They are important players for us and not having them for the final is complicated. When they are not playing it is an opportunity for others," he said. 
"Marouane (Fellaini) and Bastian (Schweinsteiger) - two players who are normally not playing too much - is a good answer. 
"I think Henrikh and Michael are both out. This is based on my experience, not based on my medical knowledge and not based on tests and what they have to do tomorrow and after tomorrow. 
"I think no chance. A calf, a hamstring, even if it is minor, some fibres, damage, I think [they are] out." Manchester United's Michael Carrick after being substituted (Photo: REUTERS) Jose Mourinho looks on (Photo: Christopher Lee) 
Mourinho named a strong side for the second leg with St Etienne despite leading 3-0 from the opener. 
Wayne Rooney did not travel to France and could also miss out on Sunday's final. poll loading Who will win the EFL Cup? 1000+ VOTES SO FAR
